definition: to discount the interest on a bill of exchange
to stick/to paste/to post (e.g. on a blog)/to keep close to/to fit snugly/to subsidize/allowance (e.g. money for food or housing)/sticker/classifier for sticking plaster: strip
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: Interest tax and measures to reduce the possibility of bringing out the market?
sentences.chinese: 貼息等稅費降低措施能否帶火樓市？

sentences.english: Part one is the theoretical research on the fiscal interest-subsidy of the student loan.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分，學生貸款財政貼息的理論分析。

sentences.english: The provision of investment subsidies and interest discount funds shall be gratuitous.
sentences.chinese: 投資補助和貼息資金均爲無償投入。

sentences.english: Price, Sheng a major fall in factory acceptance discount.
sentences.chinese: 價格方面，盛澤一主流工廠承兌貼息下調。

sentences.english: Part three is about the situation and problems of interest-subsidy in our country.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分，我國學生貸款財政貼息的現狀。

sentences.english: It shall also, pursuant to the procedures for budgetary management, distribute the budget of interest-subsidy funds for the project concerned.
sentences.chinese: 並按照預算管理程序要求，下達項目貼息資金預算。

definition: taxation/in former times, esp. land tax

family members of nationals residing abroad
